items.headline: U.S. Equities Show Resilience Amid Tariff Uncertainty and Mixed Economic Signals
items.summary: U.S. major indices concluded Friday's session with gains, continuing weekly positive trends. However, Monday's pre-market saw S&P 500 futures dip 0.6%, Nasdaq 100 contracts fall 0.7%, and Dow futures drop 0.4% following President Trump's announcement of new 15% global tariffs under Section 122, coming after a Supreme Court ruling against his previous emergency levies. Overall market sentiment remains cautious with mixed feelings, as traders closely monitor economic indicators and ongoing geopolitical tensions.

items.headline: Amazon.com, Inc. ($AMZN)
items.summary: Amazon was a major gainer on the Dow today.

items.headline: Comfort Systems USA ($FIX)
items.summary: Comfort Systems USA advanced after reporting strong Q4 and full year 2025 results and a higher dividend.

items.headline: Nebius Group ($NBIS)
items.summary: Nebius Group experienced a notable decline.

items.headline: CoreWeave ($CRWV)
items.summary: CoreWeave fell amidst concerns surrounding AI data center financing and ownership changes.

items.headline: Cloudflare ($NET)
items.summary: Cloudflare shares dropped as security stocks pulled back following reactions to Claude Code Security headlines.

items.headline: Sector Performance: Communication Services Lead, Energy and IT Lag
items.summary: The Communication Services Select Sector SPDR (XLC) surged by 2.7%, with Consumer Discretionary (XLY) up 1.3% and Financials (XLF) gaining 0.7% among leading sectors. Conversely, the Energy Select Sector SPDR (XLE) declined by 0.7%. In the Indian market, the Nifty IT sector notably fell 1.42%, with IT stocks globally facing pressure due to concerns over AI-related disruptions and global brokerage downgrades.

items.headline: U.S. Supreme Court Strikes Down Tariffs, New 15% Global Tariff Announced
items.summary: The U.S. Supreme Court issued a 6-3 ruling, asserting that President Trump lacked the authority to impose tariffs under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA). Immediately following this, President Trump announced a new 15% global tariff under Section 122 of the Trade Act of 1974, set to take effect on February 24th for a period of 150 days. This decision initially provided some market relief but then injected fresh uncertainty, leading to a dip in U.S. stock futures.

items.headline: U.S. GDP Misses Estimates, Fed Watch on Inflation Continues
items.summary: The U.S. economy's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) expanded at an annualized rate of 1.4% in Q4 2025, falling short of the consensus estimate of 2.9%. The Federal Reserve maintains a hawkish stance, with officials emphasizing the need for further declines in inflation before considering rate cuts, as the core PCE price index is running at 3% year-over-year.

items.headline: Nvidia Earnings Anticipated Mid-Week, Q4 Earnings Season Nears Close
items.summary: Investor attention is keenly focused on Nvidia's ($NVDA) earnings report, expected after the market close on Wednesday, February 25. This report is considered a key event for equity markets given the company's influence in the AI sector. Q4 U.S. earnings season is concluding, with blended earnings growth for S&P 500 constituents currently exceeding 14%, significantly higher than earlier estimates. Other companies reporting Q4 2025 earnings this week include Axsome Therapeutics, Domino's Pizza, and Dominion Energy.
